title: Ticket #1518: condor_ssh_to_job does not work if security negotiation is disabled
description:
When the client security policy disables security negotiation, condor_ssh_to_job fails. For example, the following security setting will cause this:

SEC_DEFAULT_NEGOTIATION = OPTIONAL

The output of condor_ssh_to_job is not very helpful in this case: 

Failed to read response to START_SSHD from starter

In the starter logs, one sees the following: 

Unauthorized attempt to start sshd by ''
remarks:
2010-Aug-27 13:44:31 by danb:
The workaround is to run condor_ssh_to_job like this: 

env _CONDOR_SEC_DEFAULT_NEGOTIATION=REQUIRED condor_ssh_to_job ...

or to not set SEC_DEFAULT_NEGOTIATION in a way that prevents condor tools from doing security negotiation.
